title: MERCOSUR Presidents' Joint Communiqué: Key Outcomes from the LXIII Summit in Rio de Janeiro, December 2023
executive_summary: On December 7, 2023, the LXIII Summit of MERCOSUR Presidents convened in Rio de Janeiro, focusing on integration progress and future priorities. Key outcomes included the extension of the Common External Tariff review for modernization, commitment to implement new Rules of Origin, and advancements in customs facilitation and trade statistics. The summit emphasized universal health access, launching the first MERCOSUR Epidemiological Bulletin, and the importance of the Local Border Towns Agreement for cross-border mobility. Notably, the MERCOSUR-Singapore Free Trade Agreement was signed, marking a significant step in external relations. The leaders reaffirmed their commitment to democratic values, human rights, and regional energy integration, while maintaining the FOCEM fund to support structural convergence and innovation initiatives.
characteristics: The LXIII MERCOSUR Summit took place on December 7, 2023, in Rio de Janeiro, with leaders from Brazil, Argentina, Paraguay, Uruguay, and Bolivia discussing integration progress and future priorities.
Key economic initiatives included extending the review of the Common External Tariff and implementing new Rules of Origin to modernize trade practices.
Emphasis was placed on social and health cooperation, including the launch of the first MERCOSUR Epidemiological Bulletin and commitments to equitable health access.
The summit highlighted advancements in digital cooperation, particularly in cybersecurity and e-commerce agreements.
Significant external relations developments included the signing of a Free Trade Agreement with Singapore and ongoing negotiations with various countries to enhance trade ties.
The leaders reaffirmed their commitment to democratic values, human rights, and regional energy integration, alongside maintaining the structural convergence fund (FOCEM).
practical_applications: Extended the mandate for the review of the Common External Tariff (CET) for one year to modernize the tariff structure.
Committed to implementing the new MERCOSUR Rules of Origin (ROM) concluded in July 2023.
Launched the first MERCOSUR Epidemiological Bulletin to share epidemiological information among member states.
Endorsed the Local Border Towns Agreement to facilitate cross-border mobility and services.
Welcomed progress on a MERCOSUR cooperation instrument on cybersecurity to enhance coordination and response.
Signed the MERCOSUR-Singapore Free Trade Agreement, marking the first agreement with an Asia-Pacific partner.
Maintained the FOCEM (Structural Convergence Fund) to support integration and development initiatives within MERCOSUR.
Advanced discussions on trade agreements with Chile, Colombia, Peru, Ecuador, and explored negotiations with El Salvador, Dominican Republic, UAE, Canada, Indonesia, and Vietnam.
commitments: Extend the mandate for the review of the Common External Tariff (CET) for one year.
Implement the new MERCOSUR Rules of Origin (ROM) concluded in July 2023.
Launch the first MERCOSUR Epidemiological Bulletin.

issues: Low faithfulness - check for hallucinations in basic or strategic extra data

commitment_details.text: Extend the mandate for the review of the Common External Tariff (CET) for one year.
Implement the new MERCOSUR Rules of Origin (ROM) concluded in July 2023.
Launch the first MERCOSUR Epidemiological Bulletin.

kpi_list.kpi_text: Extend the mandate of the Group ad hoc for one year to modernize the Common External Tariff.
kpi_list.measurement_method: Review of tariff structure and implementation progress

kpi_list.kpi_text: Implement the new MERCOSUR Rules of Origin (ROM) concluded in July 2023.
kpi_list.metric_name: Implementation of MERCOSUR Rules of Origin
kpi_list.target_description: Internalize and implement the new Rules of Origin.
kpi_list.measurement_method: Monitoring compliance with the new rules

kpi_list.kpi_text: Launch the first MERCOSUR Epidemiological Bulletin.
kpi_list.target_description: Provide a platform for sharing epidemiological information.
kpi_list.measurement_method: Publication and distribution of the bulletin

kpi_list.kpi_text: Sign the MERCOSUR-Singapore Free Trade Agreement.
kpi_list.target_description: Establish a free trade agreement with Singapore.

kpi_list.kpi_text: Strengthen democratic values, human-rights protection and social participation within MERCOSUR.
kpi_list.target_description: Enhance the protection of human rights and social participation.
Ensure the continuation of the structural-convergence fund.
kpi_list.measurement_method: Review of fund allocation and usage

kpi_list.kpi_text: Advance discussions with Chile, Colombia, Peru, Ecuador and explore talks with El Salvador, Dominican Republic, UAE, Canada, Indonesia and Vietnam.
kpi_list.target_description: Enhance trade relations with specified countries.

kpi_list.kpi_text: Deepen regional energy integration (electricity, gas) and collaboration on critical minerals.
kpi_list.measurement_method: Evaluation of energy projects and collaborations

kpi_list.kpi_text: Promote the certification of the Sello Empresa Mujer.
kpi_list.metric_name: Promotion of Gender Equality in Business
kpi_list.target_description: Encourage the certification to support women entrepreneurs.

sdg_alignment: SDG 8: Decent Work and Economic Growth

top_actors.name: Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva
top_actors.justification: As the President of Brazil and a key figure in MERCOSUR, Lula is prominently mentioned and plays a crucial role in shaping the agenda and decisions of the summit.

top_actors.name: Alberto Ángel Fernández
top_actors.justification: The President of Argentina, Fernández is also a significant actor in the discussions, representing one of the largest economies in MERCOSUR and influencing key economic and trade decisions.

top_actors.name: MERCOSUR
top_actors.justification: As the overarching organization facilitating the integration and cooperation among member states, MERCOSUR is central to all discussions and initiatives outlined in the document.

top_themes.name: Digital Trade
top_themes.justification: Digital trade is central to the document's main message as it emphasizes the importance of e-commerce agreements and digital economic integration, which are crucial for the MERCOSUR bloc's future economic strategies.

top_themes.name: Cybersecurity
top_themes.justification: Cybersecurity is highlighted as a key area of focus, reflecting the need for enhanced cooperation in digital security to protect trade and data integrity, which is vital for fostering trust in digital platforms.

top_themes.name: Digital Inclusion
top_themes.justification: Digital inclusion is emphasized as a strategic objective to ensure equitable access to digital resources, which is essential for social cohesion and development within the MERCOSUR region.
